definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: And slowly the kind man comes closer loses his rage sits down at table.
sentences.chinese: 那個和藹的男人走近了，熄滅怒火在桌子旁坐下來。
卡布又朝女孩走近了一步。

sentences.english: He attempted a short cut over a hill to the school. (adj.
sentences.chinese: 他嘗試着越過山走近道去學校。

sentences.english: If you see someone you know, then go over and see what's going on with them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你看到認識的人，走近他們去看他們在做些什麼。

sentences.english: Alexis approaches Carroll and shoots him.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷克西斯走近凱文，射殺了他。

sentences.english: Forth from thy hovel door thou Ethiopia com ist to me.
sentences.chinese: 你埃塞俄比亞人，從你的茅屋的門裏走出，向我走近。

sentences.english: As I got closer, I could make out a woman's bloody torso.
sentences.chinese: 走近後，我辨認出一個女人血淋淋的軀幹。

sentences.english: As you are near, listen carefully the quivering leaves are my waiting zeal.
sentences.chinese: 當你走近，請你細聽，那顫抖的葉是我等待的熱情。

sentences.english: Mirella approached him and, after a brief hesitation, shook his hand.
sentences.chinese: 米雷拉走近他，猶豫片刻後，和他握了握手。

sentences.english: As Iapproached him, he gave me anod of greeting.
sentences.chinese: 當我走近他時，他向我點頭致意。

sentences.english: When she walked near to the door, Lily found the door locked.
sentences.chinese: 當黎黎走近房門時，她發現門鎖着。

sentences.english: In the garage Jack approaches Cofell’s driver.
sentences.chinese: 在停車場，傑克走近了拉菲爾的司機。

sentences.english: He reined his horse back as he approached the busy road.
sentences.chinese: 他走近擁擠的公路時勒住馬。

sentences.english: She neared the crest of a hillock and was soon out of sight.
sentences.chinese: 它走近一座小山丘的頂部，很快就不見了蹤影。

sentences.english: Gothic building made of wood and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 走近了看，這座哥特式建築陰慘恐怖。

definition: to push aside/to part/to brush away
to raise one's head/to gain ground/account name, or space for writing the name on checks, bills etc
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to come close/to get near to/front
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to come to a stand/to stop
to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
